title: Overheating / Cooling Issues
description: Diagnose overheating on the air-cooled Kymco People S 125i scooter.

nodes.text: How does overheating present on your People S 125i?

options.text: Power loss in traffic or hot weather

nodes.instructions: The People S 125i is air-cooled — oil is the primary heat-transfer medium. Center stand on level ground. Check dipstick/sight glass: level between min-max, condition amber-brown (not black or gritty). Capacity approximately 0.8-0.9 liters.

nodes.text: Inspect cooling fins and fan system
nodes.instructions: The People S 125i uses forced-air cooling: fan on the magneto pushes air through a shroud over the cylinder fins. Check: (1) Fins clean (no packed dirt), (2) Shroud intact and attached, (3) Fan blades not broken, (4) Air intake not blocked. Clean fins with brush or compressed air.
Low-octane fuel causes pre-ignition (pinging) and excess heat. Use 91+ octane. Check freshness. Pinging under load = inadequate octane or carbon buildup.

nodes.warning: Engine must be cold. TDC compression stroke.
nodes.instructions: Tight exhaust valves are a leading cause of overheating on air-cooled scooters. Intake 0.10mm, exhaust 0.15mm (verify with manual). Tight valves leak hot combustion gases.

nodes.action: Add 10W-40 motorcycle oil to correct level.
nodes.details: Low oil on air-cooled engine is dangerous. Use JASO rated oil. Check for leaks if level drops quickly.
Change every 2,000-3,000 km. Replace drain plug washer. Capacity ~0.8L.

nodes.action: Cooling fins cleaned and airflow restored.
nodes.details: Clean regularly, especially in dusty conditions. Check every oil change.

nodes.action: Fix or replace damaged fan shroud.
nodes.details: Critical for low-speed cooling. Without proper shroud, engine overheats in traffic.
Requires flywheel puller. Broken blades = inadequate cooling and vibration.
Drain low-octane fuel and refill premium. Carbon buildup from pinging may also need addressing.
Try Seafoam or similar first. For heavy buildup, remove head and scrape with plastic scraper.
Screw-and-locknut method. Tight exhaust valves = overheating and valve burning. Check every 8,000-12,000 km.
Avoid prolonged idle in traffic. In extreme heat avoid sustained full throttle. Use synthetic oil. Keep fins clean. Some heat under panels is normal.

nodes.warning: Do not force-start. Stop riding immediately.
nodes.details: Caused by low oil, extreme overheating, or incorrect clearances. Engine disassembly needed. May need piston, cylinder, or complete engine replacement.
